Epic Games Wikipedia Epic Games From Wikipedia free encyclopedia Jump navigation Jump search American video game company Epic Games Inc Epic Games headquarters in Cary North Carolina Formerly Potomac Computer Systems Epic MegaGames Inc Type Private Industry Video game industry Founded years ago in Potomac Maryland U S Founder Tim Sweeney Headquarters Cary North Carolina U S Area served Worldwide Key people Tim Sweeney CEO Kim Libreri CTO Mark Rein VP Paul Meegan president Donald Mustard CCO Products Unreal Engine Epic Games Store Unreal series Gears War series Fortnite Owners Tim Sweeney Tencent Number employees Subsidiaries Chair Entertainment Cloudgine Epic Games Berlin Epic Games Japan Epic Games Korea Epic Games Seattle Epic Games Stockholm Epic Games UK Kamu Quixel Psyonix Website epicgames com Footnotes references Epic Games Inc formerly Potomac Computer Systems later Epic MegaGames Inc an American video game software development company based in Cary North Carolina company was founded by Tim Sweeney as Potomac Computer Systems in originally located in his parents house in Potomac Maryland Following his first commercial video game release ZZT company became Epic MegaGames in early brought on Mark Rein company s vice president date Moving headquarters Cary in studio s name was simplified Epic Games Epic Games develops Unreal Engine commercially available game engine which also powers internally developed video games such as Fortnite Unreal Gears War Infinity Blade series In Unreal Engine was named most successful videogame engine by Guinness World Records Epic Games owns video game developers Chair Entertainment Psyonix as well as cloud based software developer Cloudgine operates eponymous sub studios in Seattle England Berlin Yokohama Seoul While Sweeney remains majority shareholder Tencent acquired outstanding stake equating total Epic in company in after Epic Games realized that video game industry was heavily developing towards games as service model Following release popular Fortnite Battle Royale in company gained additional investments that enabled expand its Unreal Engine offerings establish esport events around Fortnite launch Epic Games Store As company has an estimated US billion valuation Contents History Potomac Computer Systems Epic MegaGames Epic Games present Unreal personal computer gaming Gears War console gaming Games as Service Tencent acquisition Fortnite success present Products Video games Unreal Engine Epic Games Store Subsidiaries divisions Former Litigation with Silicon Knights Further reading Notes References External links History Potomac Computer Systems Potomac Computer Systems was founded by Tim Sweeney in At time Sweeney was studying mechanical engineering at University Maryland Though he lived in dorm located in Potomac Maryland he frequently visited his parents lived in same town his personal computer used both work leisure was situated Out this location Sweeney started Potomac Computer Systems as computer consulting business but later figured that it would be much work he would have put into keeping business stable scrapped idea After finishing his game ZZT in October Sweeney opted re use Potomac Computer Systems name release game public It was only with unexpected success ZZT caused in most part by easy modifiability game using Sweeney s custom ZZT oop programming language that made Sweeney consider turning Potomac Computer Systems into video game company ZZT was sold through bulletin board systems while all orders were fulfilled by Sweeney s father Paul Sweeney game sold several thousand copies as May Paul Sweeney still lived at former Potomac Computer Systems address at time fulfilling all orders that eventually came by mail final copy ZZT was shipped by Paul Sweeney in November Epic MegaGames Epic Games founder Tim Sweeney In early Sweeney found himself his new found video game company in business larger studios such as Apogee Software id Software were dominant he had find more serious name his As such Sweeney came up with Epic MegaGames name which incorporated Epic Mega make it sound like it represented fairly large company such as Apogee Software although he was its only employee Sweeney soon underwent searching business partner eventually caught up with Mark Rein previously quit his job at id Software moved Toronto Ontario Rein worked remotely from Toronto primarily handled sales marketing publishing deals business development that Sweeney found have significantly contributed company s growth Some time this season company soon had employees consisting programmers artists designers composers Among them was year old Cliff Bleszinski joined company after submitting his game Dare Dream Sweeney following year they had over employees In Epic MegaGames produced shareware isometric shooter called Fire Fight developed by Polish studio Chaos Works It was published by Electronic Arts By Epic MegaGames had people working them worldwide In Epic MegaGames released Unreal D first person shooter co developed with Digital Extremes which expanded into series Unreal games company also began license core technology Unreal Engine other game developers Epic Games present Unreal personal computer gaming statue Unreal s Malcolm at Epic Games headquarters In February Epic MegaGames announced that they had moved headquarters new location in Cary North Carolina would henceforth be known as simply Epic Games Rein explained that Unreal was first created by developers were scattered across world eventually team came together finish game that s real magic started move North Carolina centralizes Epic bringing all company s talented developers under one roof Furthermore Sweeney stated that Mega part name was dropped they no longer wanted pretend be big company as was original intention name it was one man team follow up game Unreal Tournament shipped critical acclaim same year at which point studio had employees company launched Make Something Unreal competition in aiming reward video game developers create mods using Unreal game engine Tripwire Interactive won US in cash computer hardware prizes over course contest in first contest in Gears War console gaming Around personal computer video game market was struggling with copyright infringement in form software piracy it became difficult make single player games elements which had been part Epic s business model that point company decided shift focus into developing on console systems move which Sweeney called start third major iteration company Epic In Epic released Xbox shooter Gears War which became commercial success company grossing about US million off US million budget year later company released Unreal Tournament PC acquired majority share in People Can Fly In Epic Games acquired Utah based Chair Entertainment released Gears War selling over three million copies within first month its release Summer saw launch Chair Entertainment s Shadow Complex an adventure game inspired by Metroid series Epic Games released on September Epic Citadel as tech demo demonstrate Unreal Engine running on Apple iOS within Adobe Flash Player Stage D using HTML WebGL technologies It was also released Android on January Epic Games worked on an iOS game Infinity Blade which was released on December third game in series Gears War came out in In Epic s subsidiary Titan Studios was dissolved At Spike Video Game Awards Epic Games announced new game Fortnite In June Epic announced that it opening up new studio Epic Baltimore made up members Studios Big Huge Games Epic Baltimore was renamed Impossible Studios in August However studio ended up closing its doors in February Epic alongside People Can Fly made one last game in Gears War series that served as prequel other games Gears War Judgement which was released in At this point Epic had considered developing fourth main title Gears War but estimated that its budget would be at least US million Additionally they had suggested idea multiplayer only version Gears War that featured improved versions maps based on user feedback similar concept behind Unreal Tournament but Microsoft rejected this idea Epic recognized troubles being held business objectives publisher began shift company again Games as Service Tencent acquisition Play media An inside look at Epic Games Coupled with desire move away from being beholden publisher Epic Games observed that video game industry was shifting games as service model GaaS Sweeney stated was an increasing realization that old model wasn t working anymore that new model was looking increasingly like way go In an attempt gain more GaaS experience they made an agreement with Chinese Tencent had several games under banner including Riot Games League Legends operating successfully as games as service In exchange Tencent s help Tencent acquired approximately Epic then issued share capital equating total Epic inclusive both stock employee stock options million in June Tencent Holdings has right nominate directors board Epic Games thus counts as an associate Group However Sweeney stated that Tencent otherwise has very little control on creative output Epic Games Sweeney considered partial acquisition by Tencent as start Epic fourth major iteration company allowing company be more agile in gaming marketplace Around this point Epic had about employees number high profile staff left company months after Tencent deal was announced various reasons Some notable departures included Cliff Bleszinski then design director announced he was leaving Epic Games in October after years with company His official reason was It s time much needed break Bleszinski later stated that he had become jaded about gaming industry in lead up Tencent s involvement After Tencent s investment Bleszinski attempted renegotiate his contract but failed come terms making him think about retirement instead He opted stop coming into work spending his time at his beach house eventually leading Sweeney come down have heart heart discussion with Bleszinski on new direction Epic was going asking him make firm decision regarding his commitment Epic Bleszinski opted write his resignation letter next day After about two years Bleszinski started Boss Key Productions in President Mike Capps announced his retirement in December cited reasons as arrival baby boy he was having with his wife his plans be stay at home dad He subsequently announced his departure his advisory role as well as his affiliation with company in March Rod Fergusson had been lead developer Gears War series left Epic in August Fergusson stated that he had seen direction that Tencent acquisition would have taken company was not interested in free play style games but instead wanted continue developing AAA big narrative big story big impact game Fergusson briefly joined Irrational Games owned by K Games help complete BioShock Infinite While Fergusson talked with K about potentially continuing Gears War series leading talks between K Games Epic Microsoft As result Microsoft acquired rights Gears War on January eventually assigned those Microsoft Game Studios Fergusson moved Black Tusk Studios owned by Microsoft Game Studios take on lead development new Gears title with studio being rebranded as Coalition first game since acquisition Gears War was released in October Adrian Chmielarz founder People Can Fly joined Epic his studio was acquired earlier in decided leave after Tencent s acquisition stating that he other former People Can Fly members did not believe free play games as service direction fit own personal vision direction they wanted go Chmielarz these others left Epic in late form Astronauts Lee Perry lead designer on both Unreal Gears War series felt that Epic has started grow large maintain role as an eccentric game developer Coupled with studio s need more management support games as service model Perry felt that creative freedom would become limited He five other senior people left Epic form new studio Bitmonster Epic continued on its goal deliver games as service following these departures Fortnite was serve as testbed living games but with shifts in staff as well as shifting its engine from Unreal Engine its release suffered some setback Epic started additional projects free play community developed Unreal Tournament first announced in free play multiplayer online battle arena game Paragon launched in Microsoft Windows PlayStation Epic also released remastered version Shadow Complex newer consoles computers in first foray into virtual reality with release Robo Recall Oculus Rift investment infusion from Tencent allowed Epic Games relicense Unreal Engine engine in March be free all users develop with with Epic taking royalties on games developed with engine In June Epic agreed allow Epic Games Poland depart company sold its shares in studio studio reverted former name People Can Fly Bulletstorm IP was retained by People Can Fly has since launched remastered version called Bulletstorm Full Clip Edition on April published by Gearbox Software Fortnite success present Epic s Fortnite exhibition space at E By July Fortnite was finally in state public play Epic launched title through paid early access then with full free play release expected in Following on popularity PlayerUnknown s Battlegrounds battle royale game released earlier in Epic developed variant Fortnite called Fortnite Battle Royale which was released in September as free play title across computer console mobile platforms Fortnite Battle Royale quickly gained an audience amassing over million players by May with estimates having earned over US billion by July through microtransactions including its battle pass system Epic Games which had been valued at around US million at time Tencent s acquisition was estimated be worth US billion in July due Fortnite Battle Royale expected surpass US billion by end with projected growth game Player count continued expand Epic broke new ground by convincing Sony change its stance on cross platform play allowing players on any device compete with each other in Fortnite Battle Royale Fortnite has drawn nearly million players as March Fortnite s commercial success enabled Epic make several changes its other product offerings In July it reduced revenue cut that it took assets sold on Unreal Engine Marketplace from Epic launched Epic Games Store digital storefront compete with services like Steam GOG com not only taking only cut revenue compared industry standard but also eliminated cut games using Unreal engine sold via storefront However company also refocused its development efforts provide more support Unreal Fortnite by ending support Paragon Unreal Tournament financial success Fortnite brought additional investment into Epic Games Epic Games was one eleven companies selected be part Disney Accelerator program in providing Epic equity investment access some Disney s executives potential opportunity work with Disney in future Disney had selected both Epic aXiomatic as potential leads in growing esports arena Epic announced in October that it had acquired US billion in investment from seven firms KKR ICONIQ Capital Smash Ventures aXiomatic Vulcan Capital Kleiner Perkins Lightspeed Venture Partners firms join Tencent Disney Endeavor as minority shareholders in Epic which still controlled by Sweeney With investment Epic Games was estimated have nearly US billion valuation in October Besides expanding support Fortnite Epic Games Store these investments allowed Epic acquire additional firms In January it was announced that Epic had acquired Cloudgine developer cloud based gaming software company also announced acquisition Kamu firm that offered anti cheat software in October year later in January Epic acquired Lateral Agog Labs Lateral known its digital human creations using combination digital technology motion capture other tools create photo realistic human subjects in real time Epic plans add some Lateral s features Unreal Engine Agog had developed SkookumScript platform scripting events in video games on announcement this acquisition Agog stated they will stop development SkookumScript work more on Unreal Engine scripting support Epic s has used its windfall support its products In January following dispute between Improbable Unity Technologies over changes acceptable uses Unity game engine Epic announced it was partnering with Improbable launch US million fund help bring developers they believe affected by these changes towards solutions that are more open would have fewer service compatibilities Epic launched US million prize pool in February Fortnite related esports activities that it plans run from onward expand its esports initiatives Epic Games hired Nate Nanzer from Blizzard Entertainment commissioner Overwatch League in May At Game Developers Conference Epic announced it was launching US million MegaGrants initiative allowing anyone apply up US in funding support game development using Unreal Engine any project even if not directly games related that would benefit Unreal Engine One first major funded entities under this was Blender Foundation in July having received US million from MegaGrants funding help them improve professionalize Blender tools D art creation Epic acquired Psyonix developer Rocket League in May Epic Psyonix have had past history as Psyonix was originally founded few miles from Epic s headquarters had helped support Epic s Unreal Tournament Epic acquired Twinmotion visualization tool used in architectural design in May from Abvent which they plan expand incorporate into Unreal Engine offerings Epic Games was given British Academy Film Television Arts Special Award in June its past continuing developments Unreal Engine software which also earned it Engineering Excellence Award from Hollywood Professional Association In November Epic acquired Quixel world s largest photogrammetry asset library which makes D models objects based on real world high definition photography Epic plans open Quixel s existing library models users Unreal Engine while Quixel staff will continue build out its assets within Epic Products Video games Main article List games by Epic Games Epic Games known games such as ZZT developed by founder Tim Sweeney various shareware titles including Jazz Jackrabbit Epic Pinball Unreal video game series which used as showcase its Unreal Engine Gears War series which now owned by Coalition Microsoft Game Studios Infinity Blade Shadow Complex Bulletstorm Fortnite Unreal Engine Main article Unreal Engine Epic proprietor four successful game engines in video game industry Each Unreal Engine has complete feature set graphical rendering sound processing physics that can be widely adapted fit specific needs game developer that does not want code its own engine from scratch four engines Epic has created are Unreal Engine Unreal Engine including its X releases Unreal Engine Unreal Engine Epic also provides support Unreal marketplace digital storefront creators sell Unreal assets other developers Epic Games Store Main article Epic Games Store Epic announced its own Epic Games Store an open digital storefront games on December which launched few days later with Game Awards presentation Differing from Valve s Steam storefront which takes revenues revenue sharing agreement from sale game Epic Game Store will take as well as foregoing games developed in Unreal Engine anticipating that these lower revenue sharing agreements will draw developers it Subsidiaries divisions Inside Epic Games Berlin Name Area Location Founded Acquired Ref Lateral Motion capture digitization Novi Sad Serbia Agog Labs Game scripting engines Vancouver Canada Chair Entertainment Video game development Salt Lake City US Cloudgine Cloud based gaming technology Edinburgh Scotland Epic Games Berlin Video game development Berlin Germany N Epic Games China Video game development Shanghai China Epic Games Cologne Video game development Cologne Germany Epic Games Japan Video game development Yokohama Japan Epic Games Korea Video game development Seoul South Korea Epic Games Montreal Video game development Montreal Canada Epic Games New Zealand Australia Video game development N Epic Games Seattle Video game development Bellevue Washington US Epic Games Stockholm Video game development Stockholm Sweden Epic Games UK b Video game development Sunderland England Kamu Anti cheat software Helsinki Finland Psyonix Video game development Rocket League San Diego US Quixel Photogrammetry assets Uppsala Sweden Former Name Location Founded Acquired Divested Fate Ref Impossible Studios Baltimore US Closed People Can Fly Warsaw Poland Sold management Litigation with Silicon Knights On July Canadian game studio Silicon Knights sued Epic Games failure provide working game engine causing Ontario based game developer experience considerable losses suit alleged that Epic Games was sabotaging Unreal Engine licensees Epic s licensing document stated that working version engine would be available within six months Xbox developer kits being released Silicon Knights claimed that Epic not only missed this deadline but that working version engine was eventually released documentation was insufficient game studio also claimed Epic had withheld vital improvements game engine claiming they were game specific while also using licensing fees fund development its own titles rather than engine itself In August Epic Games counter sued Silicon Knights alleging studio was aware it signed on that certain features Unreal Engine were still in development that components would continue be developed added as Epic completed work on Gears War Therefore in statement Epic said that SK knew it committed licensing agreement that Unreal Engine may not meet its requirements may not be modified meet them Additionally counter suit claimed that Silicon Knights had made unauthorized use Epic s Licensed Technology had infringed otherwise violated Epic s intellectual property rights including Epic s copyrighted works trade secrets know confidential information by incorporating Unreal Engine code into its own engine Silicon Knights Engine Furthermore Epic asserted Canadian developer broke contract it employed this derivative work in an internal title second game with Sega partnership which it never received license fee On May Epic Games defeated Silicon Knights lawsuit won its counter suit million on grounds copyright infringement misappropriation trade secrets breach contract an injury award that was later doubled due prejudgment interest attorneys fees costs Consistent with Epic s counterclaims presiding judge James C Dever III stated that Silicon Knights had deliberately repeatedly copied thousands lines Epic Games copyrighted code then attempted conceal its wrongdoing by removing Epic Games copyright notices by disguising Epic Games copyrighted code as Silicon Knights own Dever stated that evidence against Silicon Knights was overwhelming as it not only copied functional code but also non functional internal comments Epic Games programmers had left themselves As result on November Silicon Knights was directed by court destroy all game code derived from Unreal Engine all information from licensee restricted areas Epic s Unreal Engine documentation website permit Epic Games access company s servers other devices ensure these items have been removed In addition studio was instructed recall destroy all unsold retail copies games built with Unreal Engine code including Human X Men Destiny Sandman Box Ritualyst Siren in Maelstrom latter three titles were projects never released even officially announced On May Silicon Knights filed bankruptcy Certificate Appointment was issued by office Superintendent Bankruptcy with Collins Barrow Toronto Limited being appointed as trustee in bankruptcy Further reading Keighley Geoffrey Blinded By Reality True Story Behind Creation Unreal GameSpot Archived from original on May Berardini C sar June Everything Wanted Know About Unreal TeamXbox Archived from original on July Porter Will October Epic tradition GamesRadar Blancato Joe May Epic s Rainmakers
